column4: Does anyone know where to tweak direct rendering performance? I got an ATI card
what driver version do you have?
there'll be a line like "module loaded"
... what happens when you type fglrxinfo?
it prints opengl vendor string, yea i did
okay, you must have mistyped the command I sent you
for all it's worth, im reinstalling ubuntu, to x86 (running amd64 now, dont like it)
right. if you upgrade to breezy, you'll get 8.16.20, which is a massive improvement
... including up to 20% better frame rate.
will do that once i install x86 version then
tho i have not done a breezy upgrade before
you can also download it from ATI - it'll build its own debs, but they're not trivial to get working.
if you're doing a fresh install, just install breezy. But only if you want to :-)
ive done the ubuntuguide.org way to get direct rendering before
breezy is still pre release. It is stable in my experience (I'm running it on my work laptop)
but if you can wait a week or two, it'll be released.
i remember when i got direct rendering to work when i used gentoo, it was a bitch. is there an easy procedure in breezy?
for ATI, you just need to install the restricted modules, load them and change the 'radeon' in xorg.conf to 'fglrx'.
you need to add 'Option "VideoOverlay" "on"' to the Device section to get xv, though.
hm. ill have a look on that :) still a few hours left on my backuping
thanks though ;) perhaps I'll look for you when i come to that point
colony 5 is the latest update to the preview
Did you talk to me about ATI drivers?
I believe you did. Well, I'm on breezy now :) Wanna guide me through?
im now on breezy. I talked to you ealrier about ati drivers
yes. How are you getting on?
well, i did one howto, but didnt work. now im doing the ati driver howto for hoary
but id rather listen to you
what have you done so far?
last url i've gotten to rebooting, then I caught you
I have direct rendering. But I'm not sure if it's good performance
anyway, glxgears doesn't print any FPS. It just starts the wheels
now, two things you may find useful
First... if you go to System -> Preferences -> Multimedia Systems Selector
What do I do there? Or are you writing? :P
Can you see whether XV is working on the video sink?
you need to add to your device section the line 'Option "VideoOverlay" "on"'
where is this device section? xorg.conf?
anything more in xorg.conf or do I save and quit?
right. That'll help if you play videos :-)
sounds like a TV station's error signal :)
